user_review: I do enjoy and appreciate terrasses more nowadays due to the pandemic I'd rather be outside having a good meal and interesting cocktails with friends. I loved the experience at this restaurant. The warm bread offered as an appetizer, the fried calamari as an entree was delicious. This is the second time I've had calamari that tested so good. Not saggy, well fried. I ordered the lobster Mac and cheese yum! Everything about it was amazing. I definitely recommend this place.

Went to Wienstein & Gavino's for a work party a few months ago.We sat on the second floor. On the first floor, there is a bar with 5a7 pricing at the time that we went. The place was somewhat crowded. My boss ordered the calamari (I think it was in the appetizer menu) for our table which I found to be delicious. The restaurant provided warm bread in what I believe was some type of olive oil dipping sauce. The bread was very good but I didn't care much for the dipping sauce.I ordered a tomato sauce pasta dish. I found it to be like any other pasta dish that I've had in other establishments. If an establishment makes a mistake or can't make a simple tomato sauce pasta dish, there is a problem. Portion size was fair for the price and location.

Went around 530pm on a Thursday night. Was pretty empty however around 630 the restaurant started to fill.There was a special table d'hôte going on. Appetizer, main meal and dessert + coffee or tea for 25$.  Both the Appetizers we took were pretty good.  Nothing extraordinary.   I had the pappardelle pasta with smoked salmon and petoncle.  Was pretty bland even with the parmesan.  The smoked salmon was kind of fishy. However there was a lot of mini petoncle. I say mini because they were tiny!My friend had the steak which i tasted and was pretty good. Note that it's an extra 2$ for this dish.Chocolate mousse was not a mousse but a cake and the tea is the Red rose black tea. Which is not the best.Beware, portions are pretty big, so you WILL be full It is a nice restaurant for a date or with co-workers. Nothing to say on the staff, they were great!

Ambiance (4/5): Beautiful indoor decor, dimmed lights, rustic vibes, outdoor patio, large dining area. It was a very inviting restaurant overall! Only comment was the washrooms are only located on the lower level floor, so if you're sitting upstairs you have to go all the way downstairs to access the washrooms.Service (3/5): Wait time was long. Appetizers came out quite fast, however the pastas took longer. By the time I received my pasta dish, I was already quite full and was not able to finish my meal. Note, the pasta is homemade. Waiters/waitresses were all kind and attentive to our orders and questions.Food: - (4/5) Based on my dish alone (GiGi Pasta with Gnocchi for an extra $2) it was very delicious! Quality and quality of the pasta was superb. The Gnocchi has a great texture! One of the best I've had. It was worth the wait! - (2/5) Carbonara with Fettuccine pasta was bland. It was rather disappointing and not worth the wait. I do not recommend this one specifically. Only suggestion to management is to have a faster service with the pasta. Would still come back!

This restaurant was recommended to me by a Montreal friend and she told me if I wanted good pasta, I should try W&G. First impression, the decor was homey and also the restaurant is really large and can fit a lot of people. The waiters were a little bit rude though but they were quick on their feet and got our orders in and out quite fast. I had the carbonara pasta and it was amazing and the pasta was al dente. The sauce is so creamy and the portion is quite big as well. Overall, I would say if you are craving Italian food, they have a wide selection for it and they also have really great specials. Definitely will return if I am in Montreal again.

Large, loud and slow! I guess this sums it up quickly. We were a group of 7 on a Monday night. We made reservations but there was room without. We were seated on the second floor, ideal for groups. While seated we walked by their open kitchen. It looked appealing as the food left for the tables. The decor is mash of old bricks and iron work. A large mixed appetizer plate was ordered that had shrimp, baby scallops, calamari, prosciutto and green salad. It was hot and flavourful. A small baguette with pesto was brought as well. The long wait began for the mains. The kitchen didn't seem to keep up. There seemed to be plenty of staff to shuttle the food over. Enough with the whining, my seafood risotto was good. The chicken parmigiana looked good and satisfied my guest. Pizza margarita seemed a little dry and it didn't look like what I'm used to. We had a hard time understanding each other. I guess the sound funnels up to the second floor and echos down from the high ceilings. Be patient, sit close to hear each other and order the pasta.

We arrived late night on Monday so not many people were there, but it still looked like a very cool place - great design and good music!The service was good and the waitress was very professional - As vegans, she knew exactly what to offer us.We had the penne pasta al sole and the pizza with veggies, no cheese. Shredded hot red peppers on the side gave the twist we wanted and everything was delicious. Accompanied with coronan and alcoholic cider - we had great dinner!

I have been going to this restraunt for over 20 years. I've never had a bad meal or drink. It is my first stop on Montreal! Staff is friendly, food is excellent! Hey the fettuccini Alfredo or the charcuterie board. Best seat in the house is upstairs outside!

The best pasta I've ever had, Billy was an amazing and attentive server, the bartender was amazing also. I would love to come back here and enjoy more of their food! I would highly recommend other pasta snobs to the restaurant because you won't be disappointed!!

I went there the day before Montreal marathon to get my fill of carbs. At that time I did not live in Montreal so I looked for reviews and a place that would be safe for gluten free eaters.A few of my friends had mentioned that it is a big place and good for groups and that I could be disappointed because I like more intimate places. However I really enjoyed the place and the food and also our waiter was very aware of gluten sensitivity which made my experience a great one and ensured a safe meal. Even though there were many groups that night, the restaurant is laid out on several floors and our table was not in the middle of them. I took a simple pasta dish as I was running the next day but would go back for trying other italian fares, now that, 2 years later, I live in Montreal.

I would give this more 3.5 stars, and rounding up due to the family friendly nature of the restaurant - easy to get a table, spacious dining room, decent food. Very nice and friendly service, accommodating to our allergy questions. We had bolognese pasta (one option was dairy/egg free), seafood risotto, and pizza. Have a nice kids' menu. Would be very comfortable for a larger family group.

One of the oldest restaurant on Crescent street. I have been here many many times. Never been disappointed.Excellent service from the host to the waiter. Got bread with pesto; the pesto left me a bitter aftertaste. I got Mac N Cheese with lobster. A heavy dish due to the creaminess. The taste was average. My sister got the 1/2 chicken with salad and fries. She devoured her whole dish. Overall, it's an excellent spot for big parties. It has always has great vibe. Great choice of music in the background.
It was good and nice but the service was a bit slow. Other than that place is beautiful and clean inside

I went to Montreal for a bachelor party with a big group and went to W&G for dinner. If you have a big group, this is the place for you as they can accommodate almost any size with their extensive seating across 3 levels! The food is Italian for the most part and is quite reasonably priced, given this is in the heart of downtown Montreal and the entertainment district. For dinner, I ordered their famous lasagna and it was cheese galore! I really enjoyed it. Some of my friends who are vegetarian ordered the mushroom pizza and I had a chance to try it and I would highly recommend this to anyone as well. I also tried the funghi di bosco pasta but would avoid this as it was quite bland and disappointing. Given the size of this place, the service was not the greatest so temper your expectations if you're coming on an empty stomach! Atmosphere: 5/5Service: 3/5Food: 3/5

Went here when we were visiting Montreal for the weekend. The location is great. I loved the bread and pesto we got to start; I thought that was a really nice touch. I got the gnocchi with rosé sauce and I always love a good gnocchi. The service was good as well but sometimes we needed our server and he was nowhere to be found

I've come here almost every time I've visited Montreal- massive portions and absolutely worthwhile for the price. Last time I shared their funghi pizza with my boyfriend which was crazy good! Mushrooms, caramelized onions, truffle oil, and cheese: literally all the best things in the world.

Listen, the food here is quite frankly below mediocre. But when you don't know where to eat and it's a Thursday night during summer weather and want a terrace, you work with what you get. Essentially, you're paying for the vibes and views of Crescent street, not the taste or quality of the food. The portions are large but the food is ridiculously bland. The best part was the complimentary baguette with pesto!! The red sangria was good and the service was fine.I got the mushroom truffle and white wine pappardelle pasta because silly me, I've had mind blowing similar dishes at Italian restos. It was SO BLAND. Also, I love mushrooms but I don't like the ones they use - they chop them so largely that they become too slimy and chewy. The gigi sauce is better but no one was impressed.The dessert was actually disgusting. WORST tiramisu everrrr - so gummy and nasty. Just don't put it on the menu if it's that bad!!!Would I go back? Only if I wanted some sangria on a terrace. *Tip: I've been before and their pizzas are way better than their pastas.

Wish I found this place sooner. After 10 PM they have a $10 dollar meal deal. Started me off with a toasted baguette with olive oil and pesto. Then a massive cheeseburger with all the fixings plus coated French fries. Insanely good every last bite.

My husband and I used to be regulars here many years back when we were dating. We went back during Grand Prix for old times and realized how much we used enjoy this place, be it summer or winter. During summers they have 2 terraces to be enjoyed with a pitcher of their sangria (sadly for me there's no sun late afternoon). I'm picky when it comes to sangria and these ones are one of my favourites on a hot summer afternoon!Their happy hour (at the bar only) lasts from 4-8pm, 2 for 1 rail drinks and most beers as well as their house wine. At their prices you can't go wrong! It's a 2 floor restaurant right in the heart of downtown with a great evening vibe for all ages. Service is always good, except when you run into a newbie. Then again I may be biased, we were such regulars there that we had our own waiter and bartender. My favourites there are the pizzas and the basil pesto cream gnocchi! Oh and if you still have some space... their tiramisu is definitely worth trying!

Huge italian resto located in downtown. Came here several times. They give fresh warm bread with pesto dip as a starter which is a big plus. The portions of their plates are huge. The best dishes ive had so far is the fried calamari and the mussels. The octopus is pretty good also. Their pasta and pizza come in many varieties. U can also choose the type of pasta u want. however, their fish is a bit dry and i wouldnt recommend that. The service is pretty good. The dishes come quickly and they always come refill our bread.

This place is pretty over rated. I got the mushroom pizza and my boyfriend the prosciutto pizza. They were OKAY. But not worth the price. Our entree was very good. The fresh mozzarella ball with tomatoes. Literally the best thing there was the free hot bread with olive oil and pesto. Also way too dark and loud.

A friend showed me this restaurant and it was quite good. Price is decent and quality matches. I had the GiGi penne pasta and I enjoyed it. My friend also enjoyed the penne Alfredo. Calamari was also quite good considering many places have really gross calamari's. Overall service, food & ambiance was a great experience and would return if I'm craving some pasta on crescent!

I love this place!Happy hour is from 4 to 8. Their pizzas and pastas are always delicious and the portions are generous. They have the best pesto I've ever tried and you can buy it by the litre if you ever you want to take it home to cook, which i strongly recommend you do!The staff is very friendly and the atmosphere is nice.Why wouldn't you want to go..?

What i like most about this restaurant is how huge it is! However, you probably need to make a reservation to be sure you'll have a table.We ordered pizza and pasta! Yummy but not exceptional. I wasn't into drinks but they have a big wine menu and most tables had a bottle served to them.Prices are ok and staff are friendly and fun to talk to.

There is a reason this restaurant has been opened for so many years and busy every weekend.  The food and the service are always wonderful and it is a safe bet to take friends out even if you have not been there in a long time.

What an amazing experience! Great service. Ridiculously amazing food. My daughter said the fettuccine Alfredo was the best she's ever had! I had the fungi pizza, which was impeccable. And the grilled octopus was to die for! Highly recommend!

Nice place for an italian dinner. The restaurant has two floors. Upstairs is a little noisy, but not umberable to hear someone talking. Food is good, but it takes some time to prepare. Located in the hearth of Montreal's downtown.

This place is amazing. The bread is amazing, the place looks beautiful, great service, clean, and Some of the best food I've had. This restaurant is one that I would highly recommend. Also it's not overly expensive. Love this restaurant!!!

This place was great! They make their own pasta and both pasta dishes we had were delicious. The pesto with bread was yummy and the sangria was good (and cheap!). The building was very cool and the patio was very large. Lots of people had kids there- so it's pretty family friendly as well!

Great for groups! I've been to two birthday parties here and there's always lots of space upstairs. I love the bread they serve with pesto and I usually don't like pesto! I've had the steak and pasta and enjoyed both. My friends have ordered the pizza and it also looks very good. Items are on the pricier side for students, but I think it's a great place for large gatherings and special occasions; I personally wouldn't come here otherwise though because nothing here blew me away.

The food was not bad but nothing to die for either. Menu wise its a regular Italian restaurant with marked up prices and nothing special. The location is great. If visiting as a tourist and want to experience Rue Crescent street, you can just be seated outside and spend time enjoying the crowded street view with Italian food and wine.

After walking around downtown for a while, my wife and I decided to sit down and have a couple of drinks. The drink menu at W&G is very impressive and offered a lot of great drinks. We weren't too hungry, but decided to split a margarita pizza. It was very good- crispy and light crust, good sauce, and very meaty cheese. It wasn't too greasy which was a plus. Very good experience!

This is a beautiful restaurant - it's huge and well-decorated. Perfect for dates or nice nights out. However, I personally find the food a bit boring and bland for Italian food. I've had their lamb, different pastas and salads and nothing really blew me away. It tasted like something I could just make at home. This place is more aesthetically pleasing than it is taste-wise.

We've come to Montreal four years now for the F1 race.  This has been our 'go to' place for dinner on Sunday night. This year we came on Friday night .  The food and service are outstanding which given how busy they are being in the middle of the downtown festivities is pretty impressive.

Been there many times before. Love the homemade loaf of crusty bread and Pesto. I ordered the lasagna and without disappointment. The portion was perfect! I ended my dinner with a cappuccino as always. Great family place and everything on the menu is pretty good. Will return..

Why is it ok for 2 girls to be harassed and touched and accosted at 5pm in Montreal? Get your act together #wienstein&gavinos! After repeatedly told to LEAVE US ALONE these pervents continued to harass and touch but it was just fine because they're regulars and pay '$500 a night in tips'. Really? REALLY?! Get some class! I regret not making a huge scene and getting the Montreal police in there. 2 thumbs down! It just disgusts me! Do NOT dine here. You should be shut down for allowing this kind of behaviour to happen!And please read my previous reviews. This is an honest review.

I had the Salsiccia Italiana and the Margherita Pizza at Weinstein & Gavino's. The sausage antipasti was a nice portion but wasn't too impressive and the pizza was quite a bit disappointing. The place has nice service and vibe to it, and the fresh bread and pesto they give at the beginning is good too. Besides that pretty meh!

We sat outside on the small terrace but the indoor space is huge with 2 floors and a dj playing commercial music (not too loud). The location of this restaurant is key, right in the middle of the crowded Crescent St.The food was mediocre. Italian themed. Nothing memorable except the warm bread with pesto starter which was delicious.

We wandered into this place near St Catherine and Crescent early dinner hour. It is a clean, massive restaurant and there were a few tables filled. Service was good. Good with allergies.We started with the complimentary baguette and pesto which was delicious.We shared the Salumi plate which was okay. It had some pickled vegetables, fior de latte, Asiago, salami and a whole lot of mortadella. Generous size.We also had:Kid's pepperoni pizza which was a good sizeSeafood risotto which was loaded with tiny scallops, not much lobster. It was good.The lasagna which was good but enormous with an obscene amount of cheeseWe brought home leftovers for all of the above.

I really enjoy this place. I have tried it several times since I was young. The pasta are really good and the pizza also. Don't expect to be super impressed when you only pay 13 to 20$ for pasta and pizza; for the price I was really surprised of my plate. I recommend the gigi pasta with mushrooms, prosciutto, basil and cream so so yummy. They offered me a special lasagna with a lot of vegetables. Really nice of them :) They always offer you as a starter bread with oil and balsamic. The bread is warm and fresh, it's delightful!! For you information it can get really noisy during the week end (Thursday-Friday-Saturday). Perfect place to bring some friends, for groups and family when there is less noise. Enjoy the terrace during the summer with a fresh drink or a sangria.
Ordered pasta. Was delicious. The price is reasonable comparing to the food. The place is nicely decorated. Good experience overall.

ATMOSPHERE: Very beautiful on the inside. It's vintage and classy and has 2 floors, so there's more than enough room. Plus, in between the two floors, it seems like there's a kitchen or bar, which is pretty cool too.FOOD: Overall, the food was pretty good! For appetizers, I had fried calamari which was pretty good. Their warm bread was pretty good as well, it comes with a homemade pesto sauce. For the main meal, I had the veal with mashed potatoes and veggies and the meat was tender and juicy. I'd only come here occasionally.PRICE: Prices were a bit overpriced for the food that you're getting. If anything, I feel like I paid more for the restaurant itself and less for the food.SERVICE: The staff was nice. They did what they had to do.

It's a fun place to dine and hangout with friends but the food is nothing spectacular. I actually prefer appetizers to their main courses. The fried calamari and other appetizers are delicious though.

I visited Montreal about three days after I was told I have Celiac so just wanted to give the two restaurants who actually had accommodations for me a shout-out. They have a gluten free penne and I believe there was a GF spaghetti as well. Also was told meatballs were GF as well (just make sure they don't bring it out wit the little crispy bread garnish on it!) - got GF penne with pesto.. so good! Super full after

My best friend and I were recently in Montreal for a girls trip. We needed a place to get good food, beer and most importantly THE GAME! We were worried that finding a restaurant that not only had the SEC Network but would also be okay with us compromising a table for longer than a normal dining experience would be a challenge. We found W&G and all our problems were solved! The host, bartender and waitress were incredibly accommodating and have great recommendations on food. We even chatted with the owner for a bit who was also very welcoming. We hope to be back soon!

It was nothing above average but the bread with pesto oil. I ordered the Montreal Table menu for $31. The bread with pesto oil was soooo good! Definitely will try that at home too. The starter was bread with fig and vinaigrette sauce. The fig was tasty but it felt like it needed more seasoning. The main dish was beef ravioli. The cream sauce was way to thick and lacked seasoning. I had to put a lot of salt on there.The dessert was some pumpkin mousse. I have never been a big fan of pumpkin so I didn't really like it either. Overall, average restaurant, I would give it a 2 star if it didn't have the bread.

A wonderful for option if you're looking for italian food! They were very accommodating as we ordered something that wasn't on the menu. We called ahead and asked if they served penne vodka and they said though it wasn't on the menu, they made sure we could have what we wanted. Great outdoor seating there are lower and upper levels and it's a great ambiance. Staff were all very friendly and overall it was a 5+ star experience. Definitely recommend this to anyone who wants a phenomenal dinner in Montreal

I don't eat italian food often because I'm really picky about it.  Since it was a warm saturday night, my family and I decided to try their terrace. When we arrived, they said we had to wait 30 minutes to get an outside table. My boyfriend pointed an empty table and they agreed to let us sit there if we stayed less than 1h30. Ok... the wine was good. The food was ok. Actually, the carbonara pasta I had was ok but the squid ink pasta my boyfriend got was pretty delicious. That's why I'm giving it 3 stars.

Spaghetti was pretty good. American style spaghetti not very italian. The noodles did not taste home made. The sauce was meaty and with a sweet hint. Very satisfying. They gave us bread with pesto. bread was very good and still hot from the oven the pesto was with olive oil. Tasted amazing.
Love the pasta and salads! Beautiful terrace in the summer! I would definitely try it if you're in the downtown area.

Located at 1434 Crescent street in Montreal, Wienstein & Gavino's offers the perfect place to dine whether it is for a special occasion or a quick brunch.  The food is absolutely delicious and the service was amazing.  The venue is beautiful with three different floors, two outdoor terraces and on the street level there is a four sided bar.  They have a variety of wines and drinks to choose from to accompany your meal.  I had the sangria and it was delicious.  My boyfriend got the rum and coke and they were extremely generous with the amount of rum.  It was delicious and worth the price of the drink. It was less than ten minutes after ordering that we received our food- it was honestly the fastest service I have ever experienced.  Although the service was unbelievably fast, the quality of the food did not suffer because of it.  It all tasted amazing.  I ordered the RISOTTO DEL PESCATORELobster tail, shrimp, scallops, calamari, saffron, bisque and butter and Gaudy ordered the pasta GIGITomato sauce, cream, prosciutto, mushrooms, basil  I had been waiting for Gordon Ramsay to make my Risotto for the first time I ever ate it but since I knew I would wait years for that, this was a great alternative.  It was just amazing. The prices are a bit high so it's not somewhere I would be able to eat every night but I will definitely go back to try more of their menu.  It was amazing.

I went here a couple of times and I am in love with the ambience and the location. The food however wasn't special, they played it very safe with the dish options and the taste was rather average. I was extremely taken back by the service, the waiters were rather rude and it seemed like the customer's time had absolutely no value. I would not recommend this restaurant to friends and family.

Great resto-bar at the center of downtown. The personnel will make you keep coming back for more. The menu is larger than what I'm normally use too. However there few disappointments as its constantly being updated.The staff is warm and hospitable. Which makes the night a pleasure for anyone. Go to the bar and be treated by the barmaids who are very easy on the eyes. Or be seated at a table and view the hard working staff. I been going here for some time now with a dear friend. I don't see that changing anytime soon.

to be clear: The stars are only for the vibes and decor of the place. The Crescent location is beautiful, spacious, and wonderfully decorated. I've come here for everything between large birthday party dinners with 15 guests to small family dinners, and every time the seating is great. No problem there. The issue with this place is the food really. First thing they serve you is the usual bread with a pesto/oregano mix for you to dip, which tastes good because the bread is warm and who doesn't love pesto. But its all downhill from there... I've been here four times and every time I leave with a terrible stomach ache. The pastas are okay, the pizzas are dry, the appetizers are tasteless, the only thing that's acceptable to eat is the osso bucco pasta. There are so many better places to eat in MTL. Maybe go there for the bar, but definitely not for the food. The hype and popularity of the place is so not worth it

Came here in late september with my wife and two toddlers.  We'd been cruising up and down Crescent street trying to find a good place for lunch and found the unassuming entrance to W&G.  We entered and were surprised by how large it really is -- two big floors, a massive bar on the ground floor, plenty of seating on both. It was pretty empty on the second floor, which we were required to use because we had kids with us (not a problem at all but Montreal bar and restaurant kid regulations seem to be wildly disparate and confusing).  Totally dug the atmosphere in this place -- wood beams, tasteful decor, big windows.Now if you've been cruising up and down Crescent Street for an hour with hungry gremlins in tow, you don't want to have to wait long for service.  We didn't.  Drink orders were secured promptly, then bread arrived with olive oil -- meltdown averted! The kids and I ordered pizza, the wife ordered something with salmon or a soup or a salad or something made up of all three (as she is prone to do). Food didn't take long at all.  OK, so we ordered pizza -- super adventurous right?  There was a very comprehensive menu, but hungry as we were, we went simple.  All pizza is not created equal, and this was superb -- homemade crust, crispy and chewy, a tangy marinara sauce, flavorful and fresh toppings, and just the right blend of cheeses.  Loved it.After, in order to delay our trek back out onto Crescent street, we lingered over dirty martinis (wife and I), and chocolate desserts (gremlins).  Loved it.  Oh, I forgot to mention an excellent wine list!  So there's that as well.  We enjoyed this place and will be sure to return on our next Montreal adventure.

I was not impressed with this restaurant. We were only staying in Montreal a few days and I wouldn't waste one main meal on this restaurant again.  The caprese salad, which is always one of my favorites to order other places, was horrible. Very little buffalo mozzarella and hot house bland tomatoes with little balsamic and olive oil. Also, way over priced for what you get. The best part of the meal was the pastas. I got a speak, a rabbit ragu with peas. The sauce was good, but the pasta tasted like box dried pasta.

Let's be honest - the patio is a major attraction here, putting you right into the street action. The menu is pretty good, too, offering a good selection of Italian fare. Our service was very good - professional and friendly. The wine list has a good selection of Italian wines so you should be able to find something you like on the list.We started with the soup of the day - mushroom - which was excellent. Their version contained herbs to add a garden flavour to the earthiness of the mushrooms. I had the special, which was risotto with prosciutto, peas, caramelized onions and chopped hazelnuts - terrific! The combination of flavours was excellent, but the one drawback was the risotto was a little too dry, it was almost a pilaf. My friend had the veal chop special which was also very good, nicely flavoured, but once again, cooked a little too long.For dessert, he had the almond and rum brownie with ice cream. While very tasty, the brownie was so hard he actually bent the spoon trying to cut it.Nice place, I would consider coming back again, especially for the patio.

LOVE this place. This is hands down the best spot in the city of MTL to get some amazing fresh pasta. The noodles are homemade the same day and the sauces are full flavoured and always seasoned well. I find the prices are very fair, and they have some great wine choices.They serve fresh baguette with a delicious olive oil and fresh basil- just this alone is worth going for! The atmosphere is awesome, great vintage Italian vibe. They can accommodate large groups or small. Went there with a group of 20 and it went very smooth.I love making my own Italian food, and this is the only restaurant I can go to who make it better than I do!Awesome spot
Great food, ambiance, decor and service. Thin crust Pizzas are excellent Great though small patio. Highly recommend. Been eating here for 20 years whenever we visit Montreal

As first time visitors to Montreal Canada we really enjoyed the food and conversation at this restaurant!  We sat at the bar on both visits and really connected with the beautiful and kind  bartender (young blonde)! She provided us some suggestions on food and we were very happy! We ended up with lasagna, meat/cheese tray and bread with pesto. The meat and cheese tray was excellent and if you are not starving two people can make a meal of it which we did on one of the visits! The bread and pesto served was very good as well! The best part was the conversations with the bartender....so that made the star rating go up to 5!

I have a very mixed review about this place. While this wasnt my favourite , I also didnt hate it. So first off, this location is huge, it has two floors and is perfect for large groups (just make sure you reserve in advance as it does get very busy). The decor inside is rustic but nice and comfortable/clean. The prices are very cheap as well , and you get very big portions for your money. They serve italian food like pizza, pasta , risotto as well as a variety of starters and they have a wide variety of alcohol and cocktails. My issue was with the quality of the food , while it wasnt horrible , there was really nothing about it that stood out, it was very bland/ordinary. I ordered a Lobster Mac & Cheese which is usually one of my all time favourite things , but this one just fell flat. There was barely , and i do mean BARELY any lobster inside and the mac&cheese was super creamy but the cheese inside really had no taste and the noodles were overdone. Another person at our table had the risotto and had the same thing to say about it , just very bland and overdone.  However, someone at the table did order pizza and they seemed to be happy with it , so im thinking pizza is the safer bet when coming here. Their cocktails were pretty good all around though , so that was a plus. However, Ive been here twice and the first time our server was great , she was friendly and handled our group very well , she didnt miss a beat and made sure we all had what we needed. However, the second time I came here the server we had couldnt even be bothered to smile and kind of seemed annoyed just to be there. So service seems to be hit or miss. One thing I did enjoy was that they start you off with free fresh warm . baguette that comes with a delicious pesto dip (and they keep it coming !)  All that being said , I wouldnt be opposed to coming back here again if I were invited but it wouldnt be my first pick for dinner. Maybe I would recommend it more for drinks and snacks.

Great service, great attitudes and phenomenal tasting chicken parmesan. The reason i gave it 4/5 was because i felt the seating was a bit odd -- they have two floors and we were seated upstairs when half the first floor was empty which made our waitress take a bit longer between trips. The grilled calamari and chicken parm were great generous portions as well as delicious. Highly recommend for brunch able to accommodate parties of all sizes.

The main appeal of W&G is that it's the perfect place for a birthday dinner. It's fancy-ish, there's plenty of room, and the price is somewhat decent. The decor is really nice: you've got impressive chandeliers and nice vibes. The food itself is alright (you can't really mess up pasta) but not particularly memorable. If I had a big group, I would definitely bring them to W&G!
Worst meal I've ever had. The service was bad and the flavors were horrible. Don't waste your time, go somewhere else

Heard great things about this restaurant so decided to try it out... Reviews were definitely right on point! Great place. It's a pretty huge too (2 floors) but I'd still recommend making a reservation. I went on a Saturday evening around 6 and people were already being waitlisted for a table. It is pretty noisy but the atmosphere is very cozy and rustic. I ordered pizza with sangria- both were delicious. Portion sizes are quite decent too. Overall great experience, -1 star because the dessert wasn't up to par with the main course. (I had a maple walnut Apple crumble- average dish)

This place is huge. Great busy atmosphere. Prices are excellent for what you get. I had their soup of the day (vegetable), Caprese salad - huge, Margherita pizza. Couldn't finish it as I wanted to save myself for the lemon sorbet- huge! Excellent all around!BTW Wait staff was very attentive.

After a few recommendations we decided to try this place out on our trip to Montreal. When we first entered we were a little confused on where to sit.The bottom floor has a lounge vibe, the middle floor seems to be the loudest with the kitchen in view, and the top floor has a great amount of seating with a nice view of crescent street. We opted for the top floor.First and for most this is not a spot for an intimate date. It is quite loud and difficult to have a conversation even with the people at your table. We all enjoyed the complimentary bread with oil & pesto. It certainly came in handy because we did have to wait quite a bit for our food, which is most likely due to how large the restaurant is. I order the caprina pizza (I believe) and was impressed! I also liked their mojitos as I ended up having three! As for service it was mediocre. Not horrible but not great.I would recommend if you're going in a larger group looking for a good time and don't mind waiting longer then average for your food.

Weinstein & Gavinos was a true disappointment during our lunch. Which took me by surprise, considering I've been eating there for the last ten years. Our lunch was such a disappointment, that could easily been avoided. Did they change owners? Chefs? If they did. The poor quality showed in our meals. The hostess, was polite but little to no enthusiasm. Our waiter.. Poor service. He did not speak clear, was often in a rush(the restaurant had only  six tables with average of 2-3 people per table. This is at 12:30pm, while the restaurant has well over 20 tables. My steak salad was simply unacceptable! The steak was incredibly salty, over cooked, dried and tough! Did not taste fresh at all. I understand meat is not their specialty, but if you put it on your limited lunch menu. Learn how to properly cook it please! Due to my poorly lack of taste salad, I was offer to choose something else on the menu instead. Which I did. I choose a Caesar salad. Which I've been informed of being delicious. I guess not! It was a simple mix of lettuce, a few overly salty croutons with two Parmesan shavings. While all this was drenched in a store bought overpowering taste of garlic salad dressing. I chose to add mozzarella Fior di latte(Fresh mozzarella) $5.00 for just two slices?!  May I add that my meal included a vegetable and barley soup. Thank you for the generous amounts of vegetables. Yet I again did not appreciate how salty it was! Salty should be used to bring out the flavour of something, not to make it taste simply like salt. Again something as simple as soup, was disappointing! My friend's salad which was suppose to have mixed greens, oranges etc. It had very little of everything and freshness was not there at all either. Did they use a mix of greens that come in a bag already premix?! In every salad, freshness and taste is key! It simply was not there.Yes, the cost of my meal was taken care by the restaurant. Great! Thank you. Yet, where is the apology from the waiter? Who simply took the dish away. Disappointing yet again.Yes, the tip we left was low, when the bill was only $12.00. The waiter never said thank you or goodbye upon my friend and I leaving the restaurant. What happen to manners? Sad that our lunch was this disappointing. Next time, I will think twice of going back.

Ate outside and it was quiet enough. The thing with the food is that it isn't blow your mind awesome... But it's good none the less and you get your bang for your buck. We ordered the meatball appetizer expecting mini portions but they came out huge. I had a risotto that had quite the deep dish and my companions had the mix_n_match pasta and sauce dishes. Everything was quite good. Server forgot my soup but I was really full and nearly forgot myself. It was only okay but the bread was excellent too. Will return.

After being BS'd by Le Warehouse for 45 min we decided to try our luck here. Staff was extremely friendly and fun. Everyone tried the various selections of pizza without complaint. Good spot to fill your belly before heading out.

We went to Weinstein and Gavino's on a Friday night dinner after a long day of travel. The staff was very friendly, there was an excellent bar selection including wine list, and the pasta & pizza were excellent made with fresh ingredients. The atmosphere and clientele we're professional and sophisticated.There was one HUGE drawback in what would have been a perfect moderately priced casual bistro; the noise. We had to scream at one another in order to communicate. The noise was so intense the waitress got one of our orders wrong as she could barely hear the order. She profusely apologized. Furthermore, she stated that noise was a common complaint. Not since attending a One Republic concert in a domed stadium have I experienced such deafening noise. There is club music playing in the background that if it was turned 10db lower it would be appropriate. However, people have to yell over the beats which creates a building escalated volume with horrible acoustics. After having my ears ring and a horse throat from screaming, we cut the experience short. It's a shame as the restaurant has a great formula for success that is ruined by what I consider to be a serious risk to permanent hearing loss.

I went with my family to celebrate Mother's Day. I didn't know the place, I read about it in their Facebook advertising. We were greatly amazed by the place, the food and the attention. It is big, has terrace, prices are very affordable and the ambience is really nice. I totally recommend this restaurant and we are going to come back.

"I thought midi-chicken meant half a chicken breast or something." First off the portions here are huge! The look on my friend's face when he saw half a chicken being brought towards his direction was pretty priceless. The waiter who served us was super friendly and had quite the sense of humour also. The fries at this place are pretty amazing too. I don't know if it's the seasoning or the way they fry it, but whatever witchcraft it is they're doing behind the kitchen, it's pretty darn good. Another thing is that I love is how they serve the food when it is still hot and fresh. Everything came pretty quickly and for the great price, the food tastes even better.
Very nice food! Gluten free pasta was great. The Ribeye was amazing! Good place and good atmosphere!

This rating is only for the atmosphere in the restaurant. I was literally drenched in sweat after coming out of the restaurant. The temperature was 34+ deg and the air conditioning was not working in the restaurant. This was the most uncomfortable good Italian cuisine I have had.Everyone in the restaurant was complaining about the heat but nothing was done to fix it. Paying $80 for a dinner for 2 adults and a kid, I would except a good dining atmosphere.Food was great. Everything was freshly made. The pasta melted in out mouth. 5 stars for the food.

All around a pretty terrible experience at this place and if it weren't for the fact that some others in my party actually liked their food, it would be getting a 1 star from me. To frame it up, came here for a work dinner this evening, I didn't pick the place and actually showed up about 15 min late so by the time I arrived everyone had a drink and had ordered already. No worries, I take a min and order a drink and my food but from there everything starts to go downhill pretty quick. To sum up:- I immediately notice a coworker who ordered a Negroni get his drink and it wasn't even 3/4 full in a rocks glass, plenty of ice though, ok whatever.- I ordered the Osso Bucco when I showed up late, yet somehow was the very first one to get their food, yet someone who ordered a salad funny enough ended up getting his food halfway into my own meal...- Which I must say, was quite the chore. This was BY FAR the toughest tasting veal shank I've ever tasted. Nothing fell off the bone, not a single bite was what you'd consider tender. To put simply, it was dry as sand and was like chewing on leather. My jaw legit ached after eating it. If it wasn't for the fact that I was pretty hungry and the sauce was a tiny redeemer I would've given up after a few bites. This thing easily should've been in the slow cooker for at least another 4 hrs, terrible for something that's 28CAD and on the higher end of the menu.- My own drink (an old fashioned) came out only 3/4 full as well, yet was piled to the brim with ice, at least it was decently stiff. - My coworkers 2nd and 3rd orders of Negroni came out EVEN LESS that before, we're talking barely half a rocks glass full, with a ton of ice piled in.- I had to ask 2 different ppl 3 times to get a glass of water.- After we got our food and the waitress came around exactly once to ask if anyone wanted drinks (at which point completely ignoring I had no more water left), she never came around again other than to take dishes and run off. Never even had a chance to get another drink, which I guess in a way is a blessing in disguise based on what we'd witnessed.Incredibly disappointing and for a downtown area chock full of restaurants you can be damned sure I'm passing this one by in the future.

After almost a year, we decided to go eat in downtown Montreal.  I had always heard about Wienstein & Gavinos but never got the chance to go. Finally, I decided to check out this place. They started us of with a mini baguette with olive oil and pesto sauce. Which was a change from your normal butter and bread.  We ordered greek salad and grilled octopus. The salad was amazing, the tomatos were really tasty. The octopus was fresh with a nice vinaigrette. We ordered veal parmesan and rib eye steak as our main course. The veal was accompanied with a spaghetti pesto  topped with pine nuts. It melted in your mouth the only flaw  was it was a bit too salty for my taste. The steak was accomabied with a side salad and fries. It also raste amazing but again a bit salty for our taste. The waiter was very friendly and helpful with the menu. Ambiance was great, we were near the balcony which had great view of the street.  All in all it was a great night and I was really glad i tried it out, I will definitly be going back.

I had their PROSCIUTTO E ARUGULA pizza at 15$.The pizza was really hard to cut so eating it was a mess. In terms of taste,  the arugula and the prosciutto made a really good combo. But the unsalted mozzarella was not  good at all, the texture it added to the food was unnecessary and it only diluted the flavors.The ambiance was pretty nice, it was Thursday night and quite busy, to my surprise.But the food is definitely overrated, at least for my pizza.Everyone else seemed to enjoy their pasta, so I might go back for that.Also, the waiter asked my friend if he wanted meatballs with his pasta and he was charged 2 meatballs for 8$. That's pretty expensive for meatballs lol.

Our service started out okay when we were the only patrons on the patio, but slowly dipped as soon as more people arrived (on a 7 table patio). Our waiter was impatient from our first order and we sat between the clearing of our appetizer plates from even ordering our entree for a good 10 minutes. After ordering our entrees, 5 minutes tops, I asked if I could change my pasta option for my entree and was told he would check, 10 minutes later he came back and said no can do. I'm very familiar with the restaurant business so this alone would not have been a count against the service but was still surprised how long it took him to check. Our entree came and my daughter asked for more bread, he nodded and we waited for bread for the entire time. No mention that there was a table limit or he couldn't do it. We waited with our finished entrees for a good 15 minutes (no sight of the waiter despite a now filled patio) had to wave him down and then waited another 5 minutes at least. When he came with the check he cleaned our table with a dirty rag left the rag there and tended to another table and then came back to us to take care of our bill, leaving the dirty rag the entire time. As we were walking out we saw the manager, who had come out multiples times seeing impatient tables and did nothing, and told him our service was poor. He said it must have been a mistake and our server was the best they had, no apology and basically shooed us out and told us he didn't care.Lastly, the food was mediocre at best. Definitely go someplace else.

We are a family of 4 that have a tradition of going to Weinstein and Gavino's every December 24th, then go hand out money to the homeless. We look forward to this night so much. However you can rest assured we will continue our tradition in a different restaurant. I reserved with OpenTable with a note "please seat us next to a window". When I realized the reservation time was too early, I called in to change it from 6:00pm to 6:30pm. The girl who answered said "yes, I see your reservation. No trouble". I then saw on the OpenTable app that the change had taken place. When we got there, the maître d' was so rude and clearly could not have cared less about our business. He had this pen he was chewing on constantly, said my reservation didn't exist (I had to show him my OpenTable confirmation, as well as the time stamp of my phone call to prove it!!!)In regards to being seated by the window, he said: "pffft. That ain't happening". I was jaw-dropped. He finally gave us a table and spoke to us like it was such a huge favour.Our waiter kept us waiting for so long between courses and for the cheque. We literally felt like an after-thought and like our business wasn't good enough. The food was good, I can't complain on that front. I am so disappointed in our Christmas Eve dinner.

The service was great! The food as well! Even though I ordered one of their personal pies I shared with my family, everyone had different types of food. If I come back to Montreal, I def visit G&W again!

We were seated on the roof top patio, very nice! Got to see a lot of the downtown happenings. The pasta here was delicious! Andrew was our server and let me tell you he is the best, funny, attentive and gave his recommendations which by the way were great! The atmosphere here was lovely, it's nice for a date night or to take the whole family out! Coming back for sure!

I disagree with people that have said the food here is mediocre. I had the soup of the day, which was a seafood bisque, and a tilapia dish as a main. I love soup and can't stop raving about that bisque. Appetizer & main were great. My peers ordered steak, and rose cream sauce gnocchi. Tasted both dishes and both were excellent. Also got to try their starting salad with thickly shaved parmesan on top, very good. The bread was warmed and doughy in a good way, also came wrapped in a little paper slip. Service was extremely professional: attentive, informative, friendly. The atmosphere is warm and welcoming with soft lighting. Will definitely come here next time I'm in Montreal.
Great food but even better service. Been here twice now and both times were great. We shared a bottle of wine and the waiter never let our glasses go empty.

Honestly I have always loved this place.  Their risottos are always amazing and the diverse me u let's anyone enjoy themselves.  The service has been a bit poor st times but is still a great place.Order anything and you will have a great upscale-casual dining experience.

Excellent.  I could not find anything to improve.  The service was superb and the steak was excellent. Large wine selection.The location, especially during the Formula One weekend, couldn't be more centrally located.I recommend adding this to your to do list.

I love almost everything about this place. It's decorated beautifully, the interior architecture is really nice, pretty exposed stone walls and nice dim lighting, and everyone who works here is sooo nice. Also (and I'm sure people will hate me for saying this but...) the place feels like you're in Toronto.For starters, the pesto oil that they bring out with the bread before you order food, is very tasty and fresh. We ordered the paesana pizza and the duck confit risotto, and the tiramisu. The pizza was really good, and for a bigger contemporary style restaurant like this, it's still impressively authentic (thin crust Napoli style stone oven pizza)... The duck confit risotto was incredible. There were big chunks of duck confit in it and it wasn't fatty at all but perfectly rich and delicious and the duck confit flavour was really infused into the perfectly cooked risotto - the best risotto I've had in this city yet. I will definitely be looking forward to the next visit here to order it again - and for duck confit risotto it was very reasonably priced, I want to say cheap even, but let's just say, you can't go wrong if you order this dish.The tiramisu was pretty good, but not authentic at all - but I'm very picky when it comes to tiramisu, and for me it was too thick/heavy.. It seems like the mascarpone cream was either mixed with a butter cream type of icing because it was very thick and very sweet but I still liked it - I wouldn't order it again though unless I was really craving it and didn't feel like making it myself. We will definitely return for the pizza and I can't wait to go back for the risotto. I highly recommend this place for date night or a huge birthday party. Just go!
Great place on Crescent St.  Italian food was awesome.  The bread and pesto was out of this world.  Ate the the yellowfin tuna with veggies and fargola- amazing.  Great staff and excellent service

Very good restaurant. I loved the food. We were 9 people, 5 of us order the individual side pizzas and 4 of us order the pastas. Everything was delicious... The pizzas size is big enough for two people, they were cook on point. I had the seafood pasta and it was great. There was a lot of seafood very well proportionated, it also had lots of sauce as well as the others on the table. Our waiter was very good. She always had a smile.I will totally come back to this restaurant when in Montreal.

Sadly, 2 stars for food but 5 for service. We sat on the patio and both ordered a pasta dish with Alfredo sauce. It was wallpaper paste with zero seasoning. I added a ton of pepper, salt and even threw in the yummy pesto / olive oil dip for bread, to no avail. Gummy and gross. We headed inside for 'just one more drink' and ended up staying 4+ hours. Service, again, was exceptional (patio and bar). Maybe just an off night (Friday) for the busy kitchen?
I really like the place. All dishes are good!!!Great atmosphere / nice staff.Calamari is a must followed by osso bucco.Seafood risotto can also be among the good choices.

This is a great choice for Italian cuisine. It is in close proximity to Peel metro and very close to St. Catherine street. But now to the food: For starters they start you off with a baguette and this homemade oil to dip your bread in. Both are amazing. I look forward to eating it every time I go. And there pasta is to die for. I usually have the half tomato half Alfredo. I've also tried the pizza which was also very good. My close friend had the fillet minion and adored it. To top it off the servers are very polite and friendly ( a group of 15 of us went for supper and asked the waiter to take a picture not only did he take great shots he took a selfie of himself as a joke because he claimed to be the best server-which he was. We all laughed and for him to come in the photo.)

We visited on a Friday evening at around 7pm and this place looked filled - at least the terrace was. Inside though, there are 3 floors: not too many seats on the ground floor, but plenty on the 2nd and 3rd. The 2nd floor features a very good view of the kitchen, which is pretty cool, but can be pretty noisy and hot. The music seemed very loud on the ground floor, but on the 3rd floor, it was much quieter and easier to hold a conversation up there. They have an extensive drink list and a far smaller food menu. Their bread comes with pesto oil which is pretty neat. The soup of the day was a cream of asparagus and I do believe that in their stations, each one has bread, Parmesan cheese, pesto oil, salt and pepper, as well as the daily soup. Considering there are 3 floors to the establishment, I guess this is a way to speed things up. Our seat was wonderful, by the window, so that there was a breeze and some natural light streaming in. Service was okay, our server came by to check on us once and was fairly polite. Prices are relatively reasonable given that this area is slightly touristy. Even when we left at around 8:30pm, there were still plenty of tables, so I wouldn't say they get completely filled to capacity, given that they do have 3 floors of seating.

Nice restaurant, great vibe, great area. We ordered the mussels and the assorted meats plate. The red broth with the mussels was delightful and was the perfect dipping sauce for the bread. Meat platter was basic and again the bread stole the show. Each meals is paired with hot fresh bread, how can you go wrong?
Perfect food. Nice place. Great service. I always judge a place with a good eggs florentine, they passed with flying colours.

This was our first dinner stop in Montreal. The food was really good! The restaurant looks great - it's 3 floors so you might have a little treck like we did. The atmosphere was a little bit loud - we had to shout across our small table to talk to each other. I would go back for their pasta!
Good place with excellent menu choices and wonderful & friendly wait service.
Swung by after work for happy hour. It's 2 for 1 from 4-8pm. Great atmosphere and friendly service.

The food is always amazing. The wait times are a bit much... but what do you expect lol, this place is in a perfect location and has such a great Italian decor. Makes me feel at home. It isn't too pricey, which is good. I always get the Tortellini with rosé sauce, it is incredible :D!! I always come here when I'm looking for good Italian food.I will be back!

Attending a work halloween party here! Had loads of fun! Music was great! It was hard staying seated! You just wanted to get up and start dancing! Service was really good! The wait staff and hostess were incredibly nice! Didn't have to wait long for the food! I ordered Chicken (can't remember which one though)! It was delicious and really fresh! It came with spaghetti on the side! It was really fulfilling!I can't wait to return!
Came in for a quick drink. Nice environment, drinks weren't bad. Glad that the music was not overly loud. Very good BOGO drink specials during happy hour.

We chose this place because the patio atmosphere was good and they had space on a busy Sunday afternoon. We went for a pitcher of sangria, wanting to sit there awhile.They served some decent bread with a pesto dipping oil, which was quite good. I tried the prosciutto e arugula pizza, and it was really decent. This is a great spot to people-watch from, there are lots of bars and cafes around and lots of pedestrian traffic as well as drivers to entertain you. I'm sure it can get pretty busy. I think this was pretty good value given the location and the service was not bad either.

Yummy comfort food! Always have a reliably delicious meal here. If you're in the mood for a great plate of pasta this is a great go to. They even have gluten free and whole wheat options! My favourite part is the hot fresh bread and herb and olive oil dip before the meal.

OK food, great ambiance/look, bad service and - not worth the price. While their risotto is fantastic (not too creamy), their steak was gummy and the majority of it was inedible fat. Veggies and potatoes were very good but let's be real, that will never make up for a bad steak. Their desserts are overpriced and way too small (not the delicacy type tiny). The waiters/waitresses were extremely rude, water was not refilled and they didn't bother to come check up on their clients. Given the great downtown location & trendy look, I gave it two stars but...save your money.
Decent place, lively atmosphere but food is sub-par.  Meatballs were greasy tasting and the carbonara was bland with undercooked "pancetta", which tasted more like raw ham.

In town on business and was recommended by a friend!  Sat at the bar had an excellent three-course meal for $23! Canadian!! I have to say I was a little bit reserved but the bartender Dave pushed the three-course special back at me and he said this is excellent not to pass it up!  And I agree 100%!!   I had the bruschetta and the fish option,  (I can't remember the name) White flaky fish but very good!

Like Yelps awesome description for each star ranking,this place is really just ''meh''.Great place to JUST have drinks on the terrace during the warm summer days/nights.Food: I mean, it's Italian food. There's really nothing 'that' great about it, and without tooting my own horn, I feel there's a lot of things on the menu that my friends and I could make. But yes, it is good.Staff : Nothing special, but nothing bad neither. Decor/ambiance : probably one of the good things of this place. It has a nice urban/old style to it. LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION. This place is perfectly located on one of the most touristy streets in the city. I'd take friends there only if we haven't made plans/reservations. It's acceptable.

Came here a few years ago for a friend's birthday. Honestly, I find that they priced their food a bit more than it should. I remembered I had a pasta and nothing was special about it. And my friends ordered other stuffs but didn't really grab my attention. I was quite disappointed as I heard good reviews about them... guess not!
Food was great, nice atmosphere, service was friendly and excellent. Nice outside decks. Kid friendly.

We had a great meal & experience overall....very family friendly for starters. The restaurant has a really cool, fun atmosphere. Is it loud? Yes...but we were on a family vacation not a romantic or business dinner so it didn't bother us in the least...Kids menu is great - plenty of options. Bread was hot & pesto was fresh & delicious. Bruschetta was perfect & a nice portion size for sharing. My husband's seafood risotto was excellent ... I got the garlic shrimp but wasn't exactly as the menu described it & a bit lacking in garlic & sauce considering the title.  Was not looking for a pasta with red sauce & this is how it arrived. Service was a little slow initially but picked up & ended up being great by the end. Would definitely come back though & try something different.
Really good consistent Italian food! Love their lasagna and their Greek salad (best creamy feta)!

Went after a gym session as I was starving. Place is really nice, the menu is affordable and they have a daily special that comes with a glass of wine. My friends and I started by sharing a plate of deli. The plate was nice, but I think that there wasn't enough cheese (plenty of meat though). For main course, I ordered a place of spaghetti carbonara. The portion was good (was barely able to finish) and tha plate was good (creamy and a lot of bacon). I would return.

This place is good when you don't mind eating in a huuuuuge restaurant, so a pretty noisy place. If you're looking for a romantic atmosphere, this isn't the right restaurant.However, the food is good and I like the fact that they serve bread with pesto oil. The price is correct because you've a lot of food in your plate and it's good quality food. Plus, there's always someone asking if you need something and that's pleasant.
Such good food!!! Not cheap. I had the duck confit mushroom risotto and it was THE BEST. Also the bread dip they give every table is Sooo yummy.

This place looks beautiful and I've been many times trying to find something on the menu that is actually worth the price tag. The pastas we had (linguini carbonara, penne arrabiata, tortelini rosé) were all very ordinary and not worth the cost. The appetizer we had was bruschetta and it was pretty good. The best thing here is the olive oil basil mix they bring at the start of the meal to have with bread. Overall very underwhelming. Maybe their pizzas are better, but I would definitely go elsewhere for pasta.

Italian comfort food at its finest in a casual but upscale environment. My family recently enjoyed a trip to Montreal and we indulged in lots of haute cuisine. On our last night we just wanted a nice big meal (you know how some of the very high end restaurants can leave you hungry due to small portions). We actually canceled our dinner reservations at a very high end restaurant and opted to come here instead for some down to earth food. The restaurant is gigantic and we didn't have to wait to be seated. We enjoyed the free hot bread and pesto/olive oil dip along with a Caesar salad, caprese salad, osso bucco, spaghetti carbonara, and fettuccine with vodka sauce. The service was very friendly and attentive. We did not feel rushed in any way. We left feeling full and happy. I highly recommend it for a casual but delicious meal with great service.

I went in for a $10 to go dish and when I told the host what I wanted he mentioned to the bartender "four" and she repeated "four" like questioning him .. he said yes .. when I got the bill it was 10 for the dish and two separate 2 dollar "to go " charges so the bill came to $14.. I'm not sure if it's cause I spoke English perfectly and they figured I was not from here that they could rip me off but they did .. it's sad really to take advantage of customers like that .. I would AVOID W&G just due to the fact that they are dishonest .. it's not the money it's the principle..

Positively awful. We had a reservation for a large party (12 people for a double birthday party) but even after arriving on time we had to wait 45 minutes before being seated. Maybe it was on purpose so we would order drinks, but they weren't very good and didn't use fresh ingredients (got the Caesar but the savory items that came with it tasted rotten). We then waited more than 1.5 hours to get our food... When most of the other parties around us had all been seated, ordered, got their food, and were paying the bills all in the span of us sitting there and we weren't even the largest party. Service was rude and inconsiderate, no one ever tried to even apologize for the extended wait. Food was okay. I won't be back.
Super place for families. Tony our waiter did everything and more to accommodate us. Food was underwhelming

Really good. The bread and pesto dip are worth the visit alone. I got gnocchi with Parmesan sauce. My guest got penne with Vodka sauce. Large portions and tasty. The waitress was great too. Ask to sit out on the street for great atmosphere and people watching
Great atmosphere, friendly waiter, delicious pesto and baguette on table, great salads and pizza. Highly recommend!

Food was really good. Has risotto with shrimp, calamari and lobster. Friends also enjoyed their food. Loved the pesto and bread that they had in the beginning of the meal. Service was a little slow or otherwise it would have been a four star

Can't understand the thing with this restaurant! It was very noisy, difficult to talk to the person on the opposite side of the table. The pasta carbonara was average, nothing special. The staff was nice and attentive but I Would not go here again.

Great atmosphere. Great food.  Not from around here, so I can't speak for the locals, but it was enjoyed by these 10 guys from out of town. Ask to get a seat on the 3 rd floor to look over crescent st.

Surprisingly good, while not the greatest. Liked the lasagna (3.5-4/5), shrimp pasta was okay, arrabiata good but a little uninspired, good bread and pesto, didn't like the Parmesan the second time we went. Would go back.

When in Montreal this past weekend, my friends and I actually came to this restaurant twice - once for dinner and then back for Sunday brunch.  Our dinner here on Friday night was one of my favorite meals while in Montreal.  This place has really great atmosphere - the décor is on the traditional side, but the music was current and a little louder which gave it a fun almost bar vibe which was great for a Friday night dinner with friends - might be a little loud if you were looking for a romantic dinner spot for two.We decided on the a la carte menu even though it was taste of Montreal week.  A friend and I split the mussels to start and a pasta dish recommended by our server.  Both were delicious and it was plenty food for two.  I also sampled the caprese salad and Mediterranean salad which my other friends ordered and both were really good!  Also, this restaurant has some very reasonably priced wine, so it is a great place to have a few glasses of wine and get the night started.  Our brunch here on Sunday was good, but I definitely preferred this restaurant for dinner.  It opens at 10:30 for brunch on Sunday which is nice as most restaurants on Crescent didn't seem to open until 11 or 11:30.  I ended up ordering the mushroom and peppers pizza which was pretty good - I personally prefer my pizza crust a little thinner, but it had a great homemade taste and wasn't greasy at all.  I was really envious of a friend's order of the eggs benny, so if I am ever back for brunch this is what I will order.  Service was also a little slow for brunch, but this could be because we were there pretty early and it wasn't that busy yet so not many people seemed to be working.Overall though, both of my experiences here were really good and this restaurant is definitely on my list to come back to when in Montreal again!!

we have ordered Sunday Special OSSO BUCCO (Milanese style braised veal shank, gremolata $28). today is 23 with a free glass with white/red wine your choice. It was worth every penny. 2nd, we ordered MISTO DI MARE (Lobster tail, mussels, clams, shrimp, scallops, tomato sauce, white wine $27) I love seafood but I am also allergenic. if it's not fresh, my body will have reaction. in addition, you can tell by the texture and smell of the seafood. I am sure you all know what I am talking about.  hands down it blew my mind away. It's the best linguine seafood pasta I ever had. The linguine was perfectly cooked. The waitress service was exceptoinal. Best of all, the price is very reasonable. I totally recommnad it.

We came here for restaurant week on a Friday night and the place was packed! It was bar-level noisy, so unless you and your date can yell to hear each other it's not ideal for intimate conversations. (On the plus side, could be great for group outings --at least 4 different groups were celebrating birthdays, complete with a sparkler on their dessert). We thought the food was delicious and reasonably priced given that it's an Italian restaurant and you get free bread at the start. There's a $10 menu after 10pm (with a small selection of their regular dishes), and a different special for each day of the week for ~$25 which comes with a glass of wine. Hubby and I are already looking forward to coming back and taking advantage of these specials!

I made a reservation for New Years Eve specifically because the restaurant said you could order of the regular menu as well as the special new years menu. Having a food allergy this works for me because there are certain things I can't eat. When we sat I asked for the regular menu and they said "Sorry its only the special menu this evening".It was really all down hill from there. My girlfriend and I dined alone, and picked a later time to go to dinner. We were sat in between two large groups, both having small children. We were lost in between and sometimes would go twenty minutes before even seeing our server. It got to the point where I had to flag them down and ask for the check. I know places are busy on NYE but still not ok.On a positive note the food was good, but I was disappointing with the bait and switch menu, and the lack of service.
We ordered 5 different pastas for the 6 of us. The pastas were fine. The service were bad, our waiter inattentive.

NOT SAFE FOR FOOD ALLERGIESI like this place and have gone several times for drinks, dinner, etc. I actually like the place a quite a bit, but I will never order any of the 'gluten free' pasta ever again. For someone with a true wheat or gluten allergy, the salad is the only safe bet for dinner. I got quite ill after ordering the gluten free pasta on a busy night, which is a real shame because it actually was pretty tasty. I've talked with the manager about this and she said that they boiled it in the same water as the regular wheat pasta. Their kitchen has a lot of cross contamination. It's fine if you're doing the paleo diet or avoiding certain grains out of choice, but otherwise stick to the cocktails and the salad menu.

Average Italian dishes in a refined and convivial atmosphere on Rue Crescent. Lovely patio with people-watching potential, however, the wines by the glass are overpriced. Beer selection is average. Not a bad choice for families with children, although this does detract a little bit from the New York-meets-Hollywood mystique the place is attempting to cultivate. Pizzas are ok, with good crispy crust. Service is good. More American than Canadian.

Its a very nice restaurant with a lovely atmosphere, it can get noisy a bit but its not that bad. Food is great, the bread and pesto is excellent ( free too) the bruschetta is very tasty, had the pasta and a non-alcoholic drink, its a restaurant I will be going to very often :)
Service was outstanding.  I ordered pasta arrabiata and it was quite good.  The coffee is very good here too along with the pizza crust.
Terrible service and 50 minute wait for food.  Completely unorganized kitchen.  The appetizer was good at least.  We left before our meal was served.
Good food, great service and "local flavor" - recommended...

Came here in March while on a weekend getaway from Toronto.  Made last minute reservations, so it wasn't planned at all.  I really didn't know what to expect, but I knew it was a huge restaurant.  Personally, I'm not a fan of big restaurants, but I'm a huge fan of W&G now.Ordered the calamari to start.  Some of the best calamari I've had.  The portion is big, so I'd really recommend it for 3-4 people minimum.  For my main, I ordered the shrimp risotto...and wow! This was 4 months ago and I still think about that Risotto.  Perfectly cooked risotto swimming with jumbo shrimp.  Perfect meal!  Loved it!Since the restaurant was so big, and busy...I was expecting it to be hard to get good service, but our server came by once in a while to check in on us.  Not too often, but just often enough to refill our glasses from the wine sitting on ice.The only problem, like I've said, is the size of this place.  It can be hard to navigate to find a washroom, and there are so many tables, can get crowded.  These servers are magicians being able to serve so many people....and do it so well.    Great service, great food.  I'm 100% coming back.
Great environment, service is good, have special meals every day. I ordered the Thursday special meal veau, too salty for me, but the amount is sufficient. Pizzas are great, others are just so so.

I was so grateful for the service my boyfriend and I encountered during dinner. My boyfriend is wheelchair bound, and although the business doesn't have an accessible entrance, they do have a ramp available (we called ahead and asked, which I would recommend for any future handicapped guests). The staff was awesome and helpful from beginning to end. The food was awesome, super fresh pasta and the cocktails were great. A completely delightful experience!! I would highly recommend this one!

This place was recommended by a bouncer outside a bar down the block and couldn't have been more pleased. The service, ambiance and location were all perfect for what we were looking for. We didn't realize how much the Italian cuisine dominates in Montreal. So pleased with our dishes! I had the manicotti special which was amazing. The bread and butter at the table was also so warm and a perfect accompaniment to the pasta dishes. The menu was huge and offered a lot of options.

I went to this resto with my friend looking for a quick lunch. This place is really nice inside and they have so many wine bottles they need ladders to get to the top shelves! Definitely do not want to be in this resto during an earthquake! I ordered grilled octopus because it's not something I eat everyday. Before the meal comes, the waiter brings us a baguette with a plate of pesto! Yummmm every resto should do this!! Our waiter was really nice and even brought us a second baguette after we chowed through our first one.... I'm a sucker for bread, it might be a problem ;) The octopus was really yummy and served over fennel, onions, capers and white beans... The only hitch was that it was quite oily and it was a hell of a job to fit everything on your fork without anything falling off on the way to your mouth! Overall, good service, good meal, good environment, not too pricey and the service was quick! :)

I am on, on average 90 flights per year for Business. We just stopped in for a cocktail. We ended up sharing the soup of the day, a sausage plate and a bowl of pasta. What really stood out for us, was the quality of the food. Sabrina the bartender was a breath of fresh air and energy. We would HIGHLY recommend this place to anyone. They are building a great thing in Montreal.

Just had margherita pizza and it was really good.The amountnofnsauce and mozarella was used perfectly..loved the combination.. thebservicenwas pretty goodni forgotnthe name of the waitress but she wad awesome...if i ever come back to Canada I willndef come back to W&G....

I love to travel and find new restaurants. I am so happy to have found this gem in the great city of Montreal--a city with more good restaurants per square foot than most cities in the US--mind you,I love explore and try new places very much--But I look forward to my next visit to W&G's.  It was a Friday evening and the music in the bar was extremely loud--The hostess seated us downstairs not far from the bar. We immediately said it was just too loud to eat, let alone talk at all. We got up to leave and told the water server why we were going. He said to wait, took us up front to the hostess and told her to give us Table 10--apparently a quieter spot. We were ushered upstairs and around a corner--The place is huge--and to a dining area from which the noise and music of the bar was distant and faint. Thank goodness--They almost lost us, and we wouldn't have had that wonderful meal!As soon as we sat down, the waiter brought warm Italian bread with pesto snd olive oil for dipping. So so so good!  We are vegetarians, and my husband and I shared a bruschetta, which was very good, presented in an unorthodox fashion--all piled up high on the toasted bread. It was delicious. For entrees, he had cheese tortellini in a wine and cream sauce, which he loved, and I had a pasta dish with pesto, pine nuts and goat cheese. The plates have very wide rims and a deep bowl which isn't all that wide -- at first glance you think it's one of those tiny portions that some restaurants serve. But in reality, there was more food than we could eat, even as hungry as we were! The service was terrific and the prices extremely reasonable.So, we will definitely return to W&G'S!

Okay okay okay! First of all best pasta ever! I had tortellini rose gratinee yes I know very boring but how can a chef go wrong with that dish, Right? Well anyways it was amazing!! Even the drinks were delicious!  The only problem I had .. it was extremely loud.. I could barley hear my freind.. by the end of the night I was annoyed it felt like I went clubbing. It was terrible. But the food is worth it. Hopefuy when it gets warmer outside we can sit on the terrace..

I completely agree with the comment that this resto is suffering from an identity crisis, not knowing whether to be a bar, resto, lounge or club. When I went for the first time in 2008 I was left with a very positive impression and I looked forward to going back. Strangely however, I returned about four times after that and EACH TIME, the menu had less choice, the meals were downgraded, smaller, and more expensive!
